title: Fix theme not applying: switch to Orange #FAA831 with a 70% grey portal theme

requirements.text: Update the global theme tokens so the app primary brand color is Orange #FAA831 (replacing any remaining #F15A22) and the overall look is a grey-dominant ("70% grey") glassmorphism theme, while keeping orange as the accent for key UI emphasis (rings, active states, highlights).

quotes: mer bole hye change nahi huye hai ek bar check kro or orange (#FAA831) & 70% grey theme rkho

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/index.css, update the primary color and any orange-gradient definitions so the visible header gradient and primary accents reflect #FAA831 (not #F15A22).
In frontend/tailwind.config.js, update the Maspar brand color mapping so maspar.orange is #FAA831 and any orange-tinted shadow/glass values are aligned to the new orange.

The default page background, surfaces (glass cards), and muted/secondary UI read as predominantly grey-neutral (not orange-tinted), with orange used only for accents like active rings, primary buttons, and highlight glows.

requirements.text: Audit and fix any UI elements that still visually render with the old orange theme or inconsistent greys, ensuring the updated orange + grey theme is applied consistently across the Header, Tabs navigation, Collection cards, Search/Filters panel, Item grid cards, and the Media viewer modal.

quotes: mer bole hye change nahi huye hai ek bar check kro

acceptanceCriteria: No prominent UI element shows the previous orange hue (#F15A22) after the update; all orange accents match the new brand orange (#FAA831).
Collection selection (ring/shadow), hover lift glow, and primary highlights use the updated primary color and look consistent between Public Viewer and Admin UI.
Grey surfaces and text contrast remain readable in both light and dark modes (no washed-out text on glass cards).

requirements.text: Ensure the updated theme changes are actually reflected in the deployed build by removing/avoiding hardcoded color values in component classNames where they override theme tokens, and by relying on the CSS variables/theme tokens for all primary/secondary/accent styling.

quotes: mer bole hye change nahi huye hai ek bar check kro

acceptanceCriteria: No component relies on hardcoded hex values for the primary brand color when a theme token (e.g., primary/accent/ring) should be used instead.
A fresh load of the app shows the new theme immediately without requiring manual user steps (e.g., no hidden dependency on cached old CSS).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (they are read-only); compose them as-is.
Do not edit the immutable hook files under frontend/src/hooks listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the current single-actor backend unchanged unless strictly necessary; this request is frontend theme-only.
nonGoals: Do not add new product features or change the portal information architecture.
Do not change authentication behavior, catalog storage, or any LocalStorage data formats as part of this theme fix.
Do not introduce third-party theming libraries.
